snippet: The move would require at least hundreds more American military trainers to help Iraqi forces retake cities lost to the Sunni militants.
abstract: Officials say Pres Obama is moving toward increasing American military involvement in Iraq, with bases and hundreds of more troops to help Iraqi security forces fight Islamic State; outposts would place United States trainers closer to front lines, but they would not engage in combat.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER, HELENE COOPER and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Peter Baker and Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and Helene Cooper from Naples, Italy. Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The move would require at least hundreds more American military trainers to help Iraqi forces retake cities lost to the Sunni militants.

headline.main: Obama Looks at Adding Bases and Troops in Iraq, to Fight ISIS
headline.print_headline: Obama Looks at Adding Bases and Troops in Iraq

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
